intro: Philippiamra, commonly known as the flame flower, is a tropical plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange, often resembling flames. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are broad and glossy, providing a striking contrast to its colorful blooms. Philippiamra thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
